Author: Glenn Beck with Kevin Balfe and Jason Wright
Title: THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER
Contributor: by Glenn Beck with Kevin Balfe and Jason Wright.
Description: A boy learns from his disappointment with his mother’s gift.

Author: Patricia Cornwell
Title: SCARPETTA
Description: The forensic pathologist Kay Scarpetta, newly married, is splitting her time between Boston and New York, where she takes on a new assignment.

Author: James Patterson
Title: CROSS COUNTRY
Description: Alex Cross chases the leader of a lethal teenage gang.

Author: David Wroblewski
Title: THE STORY OF EDGAR SAWTELLE
Description: A young mute who can communicate with the dogs his family raises takes refuge with three of them in the Wisconsin woods after his father’s death.

Author: Stephenie Meyer
Title: THE HOST
Description: Aliens have taken control of the minds and bodies of most human beings, but one woman won’t surrender.

Author: Stephen King
Title: JUST AFTER SUNSET
Description: Short stories blending fantasy and psychological realism.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Title: THE LUCKY ONE
Description: A marine returning home sets out to track down the woman whose photo he found in Iraq.

Author: Clive Cussler and Dirk Cussler
Title: ARCTIC DRIFT
Contributor: by Clive Cussler and Dirk Cussler
Description: In his 20th adventure, Dirk Pitt searches for a crucial element that will help reverse global warming.

Author: Toni Morrison
Title: A MERCY
Description: In 17th-century America, a slave mother urges a Northern farmer to buy her daughter so that she can have a better life, by the Nobel Prize-winning author of “Beloved.”

Author: Wally Lamb
Title: THE HOUR I FIRST BELIEVED

Author: David Baldacci
Title: DIVINE JUSTICE
Description: Members of Washington’s Camel Club rally to save their leader, who is hiding out in the town of Divine, Va.

Author: Dean Koontz
Title: YOUR HEART BELONGS TO ME

Author: Nelson DeMille
Title: THE GATE HOUSE
Description: In a sequel to “The Gold Coast” (1990) a tax attorney and his ex-wife explore a reconciliation.

Author: P D James
Title: THE PRIVATE PATIENT

Author: Mary Ann Shaffer and Annie Barrows
Title: THE GUERNSEY LITERARY AND POTATO PEEL PIE SOCIETY
Contributor: by Mary Ann Shaffer and Annie Barrows

Title: THE CHARLEMAGNE PURSUIT
Description: The former Justice Department operative Cotton Malone searches for the truth about his father’s death on a secret submarine mission to the Antarctic; an underground city, Nazis and an artifact from Charlemagne’s tomb are involved.

Author: Stieg Larsson
Title: THE GIRL WITH THE DRAGON TATTOO
Description: A hacker and a journalist investigate the 40-year-old disappearance of a Swedish heiress.

Author: Vince Flynn
Title: EXTREME MEASURES

Author: Jhumpa Lahiri
Title: UNACCUSTOMED EARTH

Author: Danielle Steel
Title: A GOOD WOMAN
Description: An American society girl who made a new life as a doctor in World War I France returns to New York.

Author: Dan Brown
Title: THE LOST SYMBOL
Description: Robert Langdon among the Masons.

Author: James Patterson
Title: CROSS FIRE
Description: Tracking the murderer of a relative, Alex Cross discovers a wild Washington scene with explosive secrets.

Author: Stephen King
Title: UNDER THE DOME, PART 1
Description: When a Maine town is trapped by an invisible force field, a sanctimonious and hypocritical politician takes over.

Author: Kathryn Stockett
Title: THE HELP
Description: A young white woman and two black maids in 1960s ­Mississippi.

Author: Sue Grafton
Title: U IS FOR UNDERTOW
Description: Kinsey Millhone investigates the case of a 4-year-old girl who disappeared 21 years earlier.

Author: Michael Crichton
Title: PIRATE LATITUDES
Description: In the 17th-century Caribbean, a British pirate attacks a Spanish galleon; this manuscript was found in Crichton’s files after his death in 2008.

Author: John Grisham
Title: FORD COUNTY
Description: Stories set in rural Mississippi.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Title: THE LAST SONG
Description: A 17-year-old girl spends the summer with her divorced father in North Carolina and finds many kinds of love.

Author: Glenn Beck with Kevin Balfe and Jason Wright
Title: THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER
Contributor: by Glenn Beck with Kevin Balfe and Jason Wright.
Description: A boy learns from his disappointment with his mother’s gift.

Author: Barbara Kingsolver
Title: THE LACUNA
Description: A young American growing up in Mexico becomes friends with artists and radicals; later, in the United States, he is menaced by ­McCarthyism.

Author: Jeannette Walls
Title: HALF BROKE HORSES

Author: Dean Koontz
Title: BREATHLESS
Description: Mysterious animals in the Colorado Rockies set off intrigue and suspense.

Author: Hilary Mantel
Title: WOLF HALL

Author: Stieg Larsson
Title: THE GIRL WHO PLAYED WITH FIRE

Author: Vince Flynn
Title: PURSUIT OF HONOR

Author: David Baldacci
Title: TRUE BLUE

Author: Robert Jordan and Brandon Sanderson
Title: THE GATHERING STORM
Contributor: by Robert Jordan and Brandon Sanderson

Title: DIVINE MISDEMEANORS

Title: THE SCARPETTA FACTOR

Author: Richard Castle
Title: HEAT WAVE

Author: Tom Clancy with Grant Blackwood
Title: DEAD OR ALIVE
Contributor: by Tom Clancy with Grant Blackwood

Author: John Grisham
Title: THE CONFESSION
Description: A criminal wants to save an innocent man on death row, but he must convince the authorities he’s telling the truth.

Author: Stieg Larsson
Title: THE GIRL WHO KICKED THE HORNET’S NEST
Description: The third volume of a trilogy about a Swedish hacker and a journalist.

Author: James Patterson
Title: CROSS FIRE
Description: Alex Cross investigates a professional assassination in Washington, and gets a chilling call from his deadliest adversary.

Author: Jonathan Franzen
Title: FREEDOM

Author: Stephen King
Title: FULL DARK, NO STARS

Author: Patricia Cornwell
Title: PORT MORTUARY

Author: Ken Follett
Title: FALL OF GIANTS
Description: Five interrelated families from five countries are caught in the upheavals of World War I and the Russian Revolution.

Author: David Sedaris
Title: SQUIRREL SEEKS CHIPMUNK
Contributor: by David Sedaris. Illustrated by Ian Falconer
Description: The humorist looks at human nature through stories with animals as characters.

Author: Kathryn Stockett
Title: THE HELP
Description: A young Southern white woman and two black maids.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Title: SAFE HAVEN

Author: David Baldacci
Title: HELL'S CORNER

Author: Steve Martin
Title: AN OBJECT OF BEAUTY

Author: Clive Cussler and Dirk Cussler
Title: CRESCENT DAWN
Contributor: by Clive Cussler and Dirk Cussler

Author: Emma Donoghue
Title: ROOM

Author: Robert Jordan and Brandon Sanderson
Title: TOWERS OF MIDNIGHT
Contributor: by Robert Jordan and Brandon Sanderson

Title: AMERICAN ASSASSIN

Title: IN THE COMPANY OF OTHERS

Author: Fannie Flagg
Title: I STILL DREAM ABOUT YOU

Author: Newt Gingrich and William R Forstchen
Title: VALLEY FORGE
Contributor: by Newt Gingrich and William R. Forstchen

Author: Stephen King
Description: An English teacher travels back to 1958 by way of a time portal in a Maine diner. His assignment is to stop Lee Harvey Oswald.

Author: Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
Title: LOCKED ON
Contributor: by Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
Description: Jack Ryan Jr. must stop an emerging threat from a Pakistani general.

Author: John Grisham
Title: THE LITIGATORS
Description: Partners in a small law firm take on a big case after a fast-track burnout joins them.

Author: James Patterson
Title: KILL ALEX CROSS

Title: THE BEST OF ME

Title: EXPLOSIVE EIGHTEEN

Author: Sue Grafton
Title: V IS FOR VENGEANCE

Title: 1Q84

Author: Michael Crichton and Richard Preston
Title: MICRO
Contributor: by Michael Crichton and Richard Preston

Author: George R R Martin
Title: A DANCE WITH DRAGONS
Description: After a colossal battle, the Seven Kingdoms face new threats; Book 5 of "A Song of Ice and Fire."

Author: David Baldacci
Title: ZERO DAY
Description: A military investigator uncovers a conspiracy.

Author: Jeffrey Eugenides
Title: THE MARRIAGE PLOT

Author: Stieg Larsson
Title: THE GIRL WHO KICKED THE HORNET’S NEST

Author: Diana Gabaldon

Author: Glenn Beck
Title: THE SNOW ANGEL
Description: A woman re-evaluates her life.

Author: John Grisham
Title: THE RACKETEER
Description: An imprisoned ex-lawyer schemes to exchange information about a murdered federal judge for his freedom.

Author: Gillian Flynn
Title: GONE GIRL
Description: A woman disappears on her fifth anniversary; is her husband a killer?

Author: Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
Title: THREAT VECTOR
Contributor: by Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
Description: As China threatens to invade Taiwan, the covert intelligence expert Jack Ryan Jr. aids his father’s administration  — but his agency is no longer secret.

Author: James Patterson
Title: MERRY CHRISTMAS, ALEX CROSS

Author: J K Rowling
Title: THE CASUAL VACANCY

Author: Janet Evanovich
Title: NOTORIOUS NINETEEN
Description: The New Jersey bounty hunter Stephanie Plum tracks down a con man who disappeared from a hospital.

Author: David Baldacci
Title: THE FORGOTTEN

Author: Wm Paul Young
Title: CROSS ROADS

Title: THE TIME KEEPER

Author: Ayana Mathis

Title: FLIGHT BEHAVIOR

Author: Vince Flynn
Title: THE LAST MAN

Author: Michael Connelly
Title: THE BLACK BOX

Author: Glenn Beck with Harriet Parke
Title: AGENDA 21
Contributor: by Glenn Beck with Harriet Parke

Author: Louise Erdrich
Title: THE ROUND HOUSE

Author: Ken Follett

Author: Hilary Mantel

Author: Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
Title: TWO GRAVES
Contributor: by Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
Description: Special Agent Aloysius Pendergast pursues a serial killer as well as his abducted wife.

Author: Ian McEwan
Title: SWEET TOOTH
Description: A British woman working for MI5 in 1972 falls in love with a writer the intelligence agency is clandestinely supporting.

Author: George R R Martin
Title: A DANCE WITH DRAGONS
Description: After a colossal battle, the Seven Kingdoms face new threats.

Author: John Grisham
Title: SYCAMORE ROW
Description: A sequel, about race and inheritance, to “A Time to Kill.”

Author: Mitch Albom
Title: THE FIRST PHONE CALL FROM HEAVEN
Description: A small Michigan town is transformed when its residents receive phone calls said to be from heaven.

Author: Donna Tartt
Title: THE GOLDFINCH

Author: Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
Title: COMMAND AUTHORITY
Contributor: by Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
Description: President Jack Ryan and his son, a covert intelligence expert, try to counter a Russian threat in Tom Clancy’s last novel before his death.

Author: Stephen King
Title: DOCTOR SLEEP
Description: Now grown up, Dan, the boy with psycho-intuitive powers in “The Shining,” helps another threatened child with a gift.

Author: James Patterson
Title: CROSS MY HEART
Description: Alex Cross’s family is threatened by a genius intent on proving that he is the greatest mind in the history of crime.

Author: Janet Evanovich
Title: TAKEDOWN TWENTY
Description: The New Jersey bounty hunter Stephanie Plum pursues a mobster on the lam.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Title: THE LONGEST RIDE
Description: The lives of two couples converge unexpectedly.

Author: Dan Brown
Title: INFERNO
Description: The symbologist Robert Langdon, on the run in Florence, must decipher a series of codes created by a Dante-loving scientist.

Author: David Baldacci
Title: KING AND MAXWELL

Author: Michael Connelly
Title: THE GODS OF GUILT
Description: Mickey Haller, a.k.a. the Lincoln lawyer, defends a “digital pimp” accused of murder. Outside the courtroom, he confronts killers, crooked cops and an angry daughter.

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Title: AND THE MOUNTAINS ECHOED
Description: A multigenerational family saga centers on a brother and sister born in Afghanistan.

Author: Dean Koontz
Title: INNOCENCE
Description: A grotesque man living in exile beneath the city encounters a teenage girl hiding from dangerous enemies.

Title: S.

Author: Eleanor Catton
Title: THE LUMINARIES
Description: A murder mystery set in 19th-century New Zealand; winner of the 2013 Man Booker Prize.

Author: Amy Tan
Title: THE VALLEY OF AMAZEMENT

Author: Patricia Cornwell

Title: THE SIGNATURE OF ALL THINGS

Author: Dave Eggers
Title: THE CIRCLE

Author: Sue Grafton
Title: W IS FOR WASTED
Description: Kinsey Millhone investigates two seemingly unrelated deaths: The first victim was a shady P.I.; the second, a homeless man who’s left Kinsey $600,000.

Author: John Grisham
Title: GRAY MOUNTAIN
Description: A downsized Wall Street lawyer joins a legal clinic in a small Virginia town.

Author: Stephen King
Title: REVIVAL

Author: James Patterson
Title: HOPE TO DIE
Description: Detective Alex Cross’s family is kidnapped by a madman who wants to turn Cross into a perfect killer.

Author: Anthony Doerr
Title: ALL THE LIGHT WE CANNOT SEE
Description: The lives of a blind French girl and a gadget-obsessed German boy before and during World War II.

Author: David Baldacci
Title: THE ESCAPE
Description: John Puller, a special agent with the Army, hunts for his brother, who was convicted of treason and has escaped from prison.

Author: Mark Greaney
Title: TOM CLANCY FULL FORCE AND EFFECT
Description: A discovery of mineral deposits has changed North Korea’s fortunes and made the country even more of a threat for President Jack Ryan.

Author: Jodi Picoult
Title: LEAVING TIME
Description: After searching for her mother, who has disappeared, for more than 10 years, a woman employs a psychic and a detective.

Author: Michael Connelly
Title: THE BURNING ROOM
Description: The Los Angeles detective Harry Bosch and his new partner investigate two long-unsolved cases.

Author: Phil Klay
Title: REDEPLOYMENT
Description: Twelve stories by a former Marine who served in Iraq; winner of the 2014 National Book Award.

Author: Ken Follett
Title: EDGE OF ETERNITY
Description: Five interrelated families from five countries grapple with the events of the 1960s through the 1980s; Book 3 of the Century Trilogy.

Author: Donna Tartt
Title: THE GOLDFINCH
Description: A painting becomes a boy’s prize, guilt and burden.

Author: Patricia Cornwell
Title: FLESH AND BLOOD
Description: Dr. Kay Scarpetta pursues a sniper who may be a vigilante; the 22nd Scarpetta novel.

Author: Anne Rice
Title: PRINCE LESTAT
Description: The Vampire Chronicles continue after a long hiatus.

Author: Emily St John Mandel
Title: STATION ELEVEN
Description: A traveling theater company looks for an audience among a global pandemic’s survivors.

Author: Anita Diamant
Title: THE BOSTON GIRL
Description: The daughter of Jewish immigrants grows up in early-20th- century Boston; by the author of “The Red Tent.”

Author: Jan Karon
Title: SOMEWHERE SAFE WITH SOMEBODY GOOD
Description: The Mitford character Father Tim finds friends and family wrestling with difficulties.

Author: Mary Higgins Clark and Alafair Burke
Title: THE CINDERELLA MURDER
Contributor: by Mary Higgins Clark and Alafair Burke
Description: A TV producer plans a show about a cold case — the killing of a student found with one shoe missing.

Author: Marilynne Robinson
Title: LILA
Description: The early life of the woman who becomes the wife of the widower and minister John Ames; a back story to "Gilead."

Author: Richard Paul Evans
Title: THE MISTLETOE PROMISE
Description: A divorced woman enters into a contract with a strange man to pretend to be a couple until Christmas.

Author: David Mitchell
Title: THE BONE CLOCKS
Description: Interconnected tales in settings from England in the ’80s to the apocalyptic future revolve around a central character.
